sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
Updates the specified boot volume.

Inputs :

  • Tenancy ID - OCID of the tenancy.
  • Compartment ID -OCID of the compartment.
  • Boot Volume ID -OCID of the boot volume.
  • Display Name -User-friendly name.
  • Free Form Tags -Free-form tags for this resource.
  • Is Auto Tune Enabled -Option to Specify if the auto-tune performance is enabled for this boot volume.
  • Size In GBs -Size of the boot volume in GBs.
  • VPUS Per GB -Number of volume performance units (VPUs)

Outputs :

  • Status - If the request is executed successfully, Status is set to “Success”. If there is a failure, Status is set to “Error”.
  • Error Message - Reason for error, along with code. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • Auto Tuned Vpus Per GB -number of Volume Performance Units per GB that this boot volume is effectively tuned to when it's idle.
  • Availability Domain -Name of the availability domain.
  • Defined Tags -Defined tags for this resource.
  • Image ID -Image OCID used to create the boot volume.
  • Is Hydrated -Option to specify if the boot volume's data has finished copying from the source boot volume or boot volume backup.
  • KMS Key ID -OCID of the Key Management master encryption key assigned to the boot volume.
  • Lifecycle State -Current state of a boot volume.
  • Size In MBs -Size of the boot volume in MBs.
  • Source Details -Type of boot volume.
  • Time Created -Date and time the boot volume was created.
  • Volume Group ID -OCID of the source volume group.

Error Messages :

  • Bad Request.
  • Internal Server Error.
  • Not Found.
  • Unauthorized.

To use this action, the corresponding Oracle connection and credential must be created and associated with the Oracle Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.description:
Updates the specified boot volume.

Inputs :

  • Tenancy ID - OCID of the tenancy.
  • Compartment ID -OCID of the compartment.
  • Boot Volume ID -OCID of the boot volume.
  • Display Name -User-friendly name.
  • Free Form Tags -Free-form tags for this resource.
  • Is Auto Tune Enabled -Option to Specify if the auto-tune performance is enabled for this boot volume.
  • Size In GBs -Size of the boot volume in GBs.
  • VPUS Per GB -Number of volume performance units (VPUs)

Outputs :

  • Status - If the request is executed successfully, Status is set to “Success”. If there is a failure, Status is set to “Error”.
  • Error Message - Reason for error, along with code. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • Auto Tuned Vpus Per GB -number of Volume Performance Units per GB that this boot volume is effectively tuned to when it's idle.
  • Availability Domain -Name of the availability domain.
  • Defined Tags -Defined tags for this resource.
  • Image ID -Image OCID used to create the boot volume.
  • Is Hydrated -Option to specify if the boot volume's data has finished copying from the source boot volume or boot volume backup.
  • KMS Key ID -OCID of the Key Management master encryption key assigned to the boot volume.
  • Lifecycle State -Current state of a boot volume.
  • Size In MBs -Size of the boot volume in MBs.
  • Source Details -Type of boot volume.
  • Time Created -Date and time the boot volume was created.
  • Volume Group ID -OCID of the source volume group.

Error Messages :

  • Bad Request.
  • Internal Server Error.
  • Not Found.
  • Unauthorized.

To use this action, the corresponding Oracle connection and credential must be created and associated with the Oracle Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
